task_group: Admin UI v2 - UX System Refactor

tasks.title: Design A Distinct Brand-Grade Sidebar And Shell
tasks.problem: Current dashboard shell feels generic and inconsistent with a strong platform identity.
deliverables: Sidebar information architecture with section headings, grouped links, and explicit visual hierarchy.
Account block pattern with avatar, role, tenant/project context, settings entry, and logout actions.
Interaction specifications for collapsed/expanded states, keyboard navigation, and focus handling.
acceptance_criteria: Sidebar renders clearly on desktop and mobile breakpoints without overlap.
Logout and account actions are accessible from consistent shell controls.
Style language is not raw template cloning and avoids default component-library look.

tasks.title: Create UI Design Tokens And Motion Baseline
deliverables: Token set for spacing, radius, typography scale, elevation, and semantic color usage.
Motion guidelines for page entry, state transitions, and loading placeholders.
Component-level usage rules to enforce consistent look across dashboard modules.
acceptance_criteria: All dashboard pages consume shared tokens and avoid one-off hardcoded values.
Visual consistency checks pass across API Keys, Security, Settings, Team, Billing, Monitoring, and Docs.

tasks.title: Quality Gates For Production UX
deliverables: Accessibility checklist (keyboard, contrast, aria labels, focus order).
Responsive QA matrix for wide monitors, laptops, tablets, and mobile.
UI regression screenshot baselines for core navigation and dashboard states.
acceptance_criteria: Critical routes pass defined accessibility gates.
No shell-level layout breakage across supported viewport matrix.

tasks.title: Navigation Governance And Visual Quality Automation
deliverables: Sidebar taxonomy model with section groups (Operations, Security, Workspace, Revenue, Documentation) and role-aware visibility.
Design lint rules that prohibit one-off hardcoded colors/radius/shadows outside token system.
Visual regression automation for collapsed/expanded/mobile shell states and active-route highlights.
Navigation metadata contract supporting future project switcher breadcrumbs and deep-link context.
acceptance_criteria: Unauthorized navigation entries are hidden or disabled with explicit policy-driven behavior.
Visual regression suite detects shell regressions before merge.
Token lint checks block style drift from the shared UI system.
